Specific Details: Oxfam Ireland conducted a pre-election campaign to lobby politicians to make equality a priority in the new Programme for Government. Our specific asks were on tax justice, gender equality and access to quality public services through increased overseas development assistance.
DPOs Lobbied: Bríd Smith|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Eoin Ó Broin|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::John Lyons|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas
Subject Matter: Oxfam Ireland conducted a pre-election campaign to lobby politicians to make equality a priority in the new Programme for Government. Our specific asks were on tax justice, gender equality and access to quality public services through increased overseas development assistance.
Intended Results: That the next Government would propose specific policy change in the 2016 Programme for Government aimed at combating the rising inequality apparent in Ireland and globally.
Lobbying Activities: As part of the same campaign we held a political hustings event in advance of the election in the IFI, which was Chaired by economist David McWilliams. Oxfam campaigners and volunteers were invited to hear from each of the candidates on their positions in relation to the Oxfam pre-election campaign priorities (tax, gender and public services.) We held this event in partnership with the National Women's Council of Ireland, and Q4PR assisted with our public relations engagement for the event. Political candidates at the hustings were John Lyons (Labour), Eoin O'Broin (Sinn Fein) Bríd Smith (PBP) Lorraine Clifford-Lee (FF) and Carol Hunt (Independent)|Event / Reception|1
Person primarily responsible for lobbyin: Marissa Ryan, Oxfam Ireland Advocacy and Campaigns Manager.
Grassroots directive: To sign an Oxfam petition to the future" Taoiseach in advance of the February election asking them to place equality at the heart of the Programme for Government."

Specific Details: Tetrarch Capital Limited met with Eoin O'Broin TD on 14th October 2022 to update him on plans for certain lands at Citywest Hotel, Co. Dublin, in the ownership of its affiliate, Cape Wrath Hotel Unlimited Company. A general discussion was also had on Tetrarch's affordable housing strategy and on unsuccessful submissions made by Tetrarch on behalf of Cape Wrath for the zoning of certain lands at Citywest Hotel under the South County Dublin Development Plan 2022-2028.
DPOs Lobbied: Eoin Ó Broin|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas
Subject Matter: Tetrarch Capital Limited met with Eoin O'Broin TD on 14th October 2022 to update him on plans for certain lands at Citywest Hotel, Co. Dublin, in the ownership of its affiliate, Cape Wrath Hotel Unlimited Company. A general discussion was also had on Tetrarch's affordable housing strategy and on unsuccessful submissions made by Tetrarch on behalf of Cape Wrath for the zoning of certain lands at Citywest Hotel under the South County Dublin Development Plan 2022-2028.
Intended Results: Tetrarch sought to make Eoin O'Broin TD aware of Tetrarch's work in the delivery of affordable and social housing and senior living in the Greater Dublin Area and its concerns about the lack of sufficient zoned, suitable and developable lands in South Dublin within the lifetime of the South County Dublin Development Plan 2022-2028 (and elsewhere in the Greater Dublin Area) to provide for much needed affordable and social housing and senior living.
Lobbying Activities: The purpose of the meeting on 14th October 2022 was to have a discussion with Eoin O'Broin TD on Cape Wrath's plans for some of its lands at Citywest Hotel and to provide Deputy O'Broin with details of Tetrarch's track record of social housing delivery in the Greater Dublin Area and of its affordable and social housing strategy and senior living strategy for some of its lands at Citywest (and elsewhere in the Greater Dublin Area).|Meeting|1
Person primarily responsible for lobbyin: Michael McElligott, Principal of Tetrarch Capital, was the person responsible for lobbying.

Specific Details: Saggart Village Residents Association was contacted by Feasible, a company which was considering building a Primary Care Centre for the HSE, on lands in Saggart currently not zoned for that purpose. The potential developer wished to show Saggart Village Residents Association the plans for the Centre. SVRA requested information in order to learn about the rezoing process.
DPOs Lobbied: Eoin O'Broin|Councillor|South Dublin County Council::William Joseph Carey|Councillor|South Dublin County Council::Shirley O'Hara|Councillor|South Dublin County Council
Subject Matter: Saggart Village Residents Association was contacted by Feasible, a company which was considering building a Primary Care Centre for the HSE, on lands in Saggart currently not zoned for that purpose. The potential developer wished to show Saggart Village Residents Association the plans for the Centre. SVRA requested information in order to learn about the rezoing process.
Intended Results: To learn about proposed plans for a Primary Care Centre which would require rezoning of land. To better understand the what would be needed to secure rezoning and implications of any change to the zoning of that specific site, on the zoning of surrounding sites.
Lobbying Activities: After having been contacted directly by the company (Feasible) which was considering purchasing the site and developing the Primary Care Centre, SVRA emailed South Dublin County Council planning department for information on what could be expected if this proposed site was to be rezoned for use as a Primary care Centre. Having not received a response from SDCC planning department, SVRA then emailed Cllr. O'Broin with the same query (05/07/22). Cllr. O'Broin spoke to Feasible and suggested a workshop with SVRA and residents to discuss the plans. Cllr OBroin gave information as to the process for rezoning - a material contravention of the development plan. The outcome of this communication was that a meeting was arranged for Pat Nolan to show the plans of the Primary Care Centre.|Email|6-10::2 members of SVRA attended the meeting on 01/11/22 in Saggart Heritage & Arts Centre where Pat Nolan of Feasible presented plans of the Proposed Primary Care Centre. It was explained by Pat what the process was to secure a material contravention of the development plan to have the land on that specific site rezoned. The meeting was attended by 3 councillors (Cllr OBroin, Cllr OHara, Cllr Carey). After this meeting, SVRA contacted Feasible to ask for additional information, but no further communication followed after that.|Meeting|1
Person primarily responsible for lobbyin: Lynn Tierney, Chairperson of Saggart Village Residents Association
